titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Archie Boston papers, 1963-2018 and undated RL.11673
titlestmt.author: Kasia Stempniak

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-02-11 16:02:50 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: African-American graphic artist, professor and advertising executive based primarily in California; principal in the firm Archie Boston Graphic Design. Collection includes print materials, posters, sketches, greeting cards, correspondence, as well as audiovisual materials in multiple formats (DVDs, tape reels, and film reels) that document Boston's career in advertising and graphic design as well as his academic life at California State University-Long Beach. Companies represented include California Plum, Raisin and Apple Advisory Boards, FMC, Motorola, Pentel, Raytheon and Yamaha. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: General Files; Creative Work; and Audiovisual Materials.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: African-American graphic artist, professor and advertising executive based primarily in California; principal in the firm Archie Boston Graphic Design. Born 1943, in Clewiston, Florida and grew up in St. Petersburg, Florida. After graduating from Chouinard Art Institute in Los Angeles with a BFA in Advertising Design, Boston and his brother Brad Boston, formed their own ad and design agency Boston & Boston Design in 1967. In 1969, Boston started working for the ad agency Botsford Ketchum. During his eight years with Botsford Ketchum, Boston worked with clients such as Pentel, Motorola, and Yamaha. Simultaneously he started Archie Boston Graphic Design, an advertising and design agency. In 1977, Boston received his Master's Degree in Liberal Arts from the University of Southern California and was hired as a lecturer in the Department of Art at California State University Long Beach (CSULB) where he was a member of the Design department which included the Visual Communication Design Program. He chaired the graphic design program for 12 of his 32 years before retiring in 2009. He was the first African-American elected president of the Los Angeles Art Directors Club, where he served two terms. Boston published two memoirs -- Fly in the Buttermilk: Memoirs of an African American in Advertising Design & Design Education (2001) and Lil' Colored Rascals in the Sunshine City (2009). He has also produced two historical documentaries, 20 Outstanding Los Angeles Designers and The Black Pioneers of the Sunshine City.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. However, original audiovisual materials are closed until use copies can be produced.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Archie Boston Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Archie Boston papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2018-0081

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes print materials, posters, sketches, greeting cards, correspondence, as well as audiovisual materials in multiple formats (DVDs, tape reels, and film reels) that document Boston's career in advertising and graphic design as well as his academic life at California State University-Long Beach. Companies represented include California Plum, Raisin and Apple Advisory Boards, FMC, Motorola, Pentel, Raytheon and Yamaha. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series includes Boston's two memoirs, university work both as a student and professor, exhibition catalogues and materials, ad designs, preparatory materials for his documentary, as well as published mentions from newsletters, magazines, and newspapers.

did.unittitle: ADLA (Art Directors Club of Los Angeles) activities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs, memoranda, posters, newsletters, and press mentions all pertaining to Archie Boston's activity in the ADLA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: AIGA (American Institute of Graphic Art) awards as well as other advertising awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: AIGA awards as well as other advertising awards. Also includes an award from the California State Assembly recognizing Archie Boston's Outstanding Professor of the Year Award (2004).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence includes Archie Boston's transition from the Botsford & Ketchum ad agency to academia and thank you letters from various individuals throughout Archie Boston's career.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Press clippings, interviews, scripts, drafts, and shooting schedule all pertaining to the documentary Black Pioneers of the Sunshine City. Digital copy of the documentary is located in the AV files, RL11673-OP-004.

did.unittitle: Exhibition materials--My Soul Is a Witness

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Table of contents for DVD series, see RL11673-OP-025.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and catalogs for "Visual Perception"; "Back to the Future"; and "Designs of Dissent" exhibits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Boston and the California Museum of Science and Industry on Boston's exhibit on the Watts Riot Festival. Also includes photos from Boston's MA Thesis that were to be part of this exhibit. The remainder of these photos can be found in Box 6.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photos of the Watts Riot Festival that were part of Boston's MA Thesis and that were set to feature in an exhibition at the California Museum of Science and Industry (exhibition was canceled). The remainder of these photos can be found in Box 1 in "Exhibition Materials."

did.unittitle: Print materials--Lil' Colored Rascals in the Sunshine City

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions of Archie Boston's design work and/or competitions he has judged. From 1963 to the early 1970s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions of Archie Boston's design work and/or competitions he has judged. From 1980 to 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper and newsletter clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, M.A. thesis, and Outstanding Professor Award materials from California State University-Long Beach as well as miscellaneous university designs and publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Outstanding Professor Award materials, Wang Family Excellence Award application, and post-tenure review files all from California State University-Long Beach.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes miscellaneous designs, posters, and newsletters from California State University-Long Beach.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes miscellaneous posters related to California State University Long Beach.

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series consists primarily of ad designs and other graphic designs Archie Boston created. Includes self-promotional ads from his agency Boston & Boston and ads for clients he created while employed at Botsford Ketchum. Also includes designs he created on his own later in life (posters, social activist materials, and greeting cards).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: clients include Braemar, Yamaha, and the California Plum, Raisin and Apple Advisory Board

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clients include Braemar, Yamaha, and the California Plum, Raisin and Apple Advisory Board

scopecontent.p: Includes ads for Motorola, FMC Corporation, Varian, Braemar, Yamaha, Raytheon, Galaxy Homes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes ads for Motorola, FMC Corporation, Varian, the California Plum, Raisin, and Apple Advisory Board, among other companies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advertisements for Lloyds Bank designed during Boston's employment at Botsford & Ketchum. Television advertisements for Lloyds Bank can be found in AV 3 RL. 11673

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the ad "I told them what to do with their pens." Assortment of undated Pentel ads but the date range covers the period of time Archie Boston worked at Botsford & Ketchum

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes Archie Boston's student work, his ad designs for the ADLA, as well as holiday and greeting cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ads designed for ADLA including the Santa Claus ad and the "Call for Entries" ad.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Archie-Boston designed holiday cards and stationery. Other designs and cards can be found in Box 8.

scopecontent.p: Archie Boston-designed greeting and holiday cards. Other designs can be found in Box 1, "Holiday cards."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ad sketch designs from when Boston was a Master's student.

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series includes Boston's final university lecture, television commercials for his client Lloyds Bank from when he was employed at Bostford Ketchum, two documentaries (20 Outstanding LA Designers and Black Pioneers of the Sunshine City), a retrospective film exhbition, and digitial images of his "If Black Lives Matter" posters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hard copy of posters can be found in Box 1

did.unittitle: Black Pioneers of the Sunshine City, 48:00

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documentary written and produced by Archie Boston on the history of segregation in his native St. Petersburg, Florida. Notes and preparatory materials for the documentary can be found in Box 1.

did.unittitle: Black Pioneers of the Sunshine City, 48:00

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A set of interviews Archie Boston conducted with designers in LA in 1986, includes a Q&A. Spans from RL11673-OP-007 to RL11673-OP-024.

did.unittitle: 20 Outstanding Los Angeles Designers--Robert Miles Runyan, 22:00
My Soul is a Witness--Advice to Students, 2:00

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part of a retrospective exhibition. The list of chapters in this DVD collection can be found in "Exhibitions" in Box 1.
